background.citation: Optimize connection pool size for PostgreSQL so that query response time is under 200 milliseconds.
background.orientation: Previous performance tests showed varying query performance with different connection pool sizes.
background.purpose: Determine the optimal connection pool size for maximum database query performance.
background.hypothesis: A larger connection pool will improve performance up to a certain threshold, after which contention for database resources will cause performance degradation.

test_file_parameters.test_title: The Effect of Connection Pool Size on Database Query Performance

independent_variable.name: Connection Pool Size
independent_variable.description: Number of connections maintained in the database connection pool

dependent_variable.description: Average time in milliseconds taken to execute a standard query
dependent_variable.name: Query Response Time

validation_procedures.description: Check if the response time is equal to or less than the expected value
validation_procedures.name: inequality_less_than_or_equal

control_variables.name: Query Return Size
control_variables.description: Size of the data returned by the query

test_materials.description: Client library used to connect to the database
test_materials.name: Database Client

test_procedure.data_collection: Automated benchmark metrics with detailed timing breakdown
test_procedure.analysis_technique: Arithmetic mean response time with a 95% confidence level, with 5% margin of error
steps: Set up database with test data
Configure client with specified connection pool size
